clinical_study.brief_title: Filgotinib in Combination With Methotrexate in Adults With Moderately to Severely Active Rheumatoid Arthritis Who Have an Inadequate Response to Methotrexate
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo- and Active-controlled, Multicenter, Phase 3 Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of Filgotinib Administered for 52 Weeks in Combination With Methotrexate to Subjects With Moderately to Severely Active Rheumatoid Arthritis Who Have an Inadequate Response to Methotrexate

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the effects of filgotinib versus placebo for the treatment of signs and symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis (RA) as measured by the percentage of participants achieving an American College of Rheumatology 20% improvement response (ACR20) at Week 12.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved an American College of Rheumatology (ACR) 20% Improvement (ACR20) Response at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: ACR20 response is achieved when the participant has: ≥20% improvement (reduction) from baseline in tender joint count based on 68 joints (TJC68), swollen joint count based on 66 joints (SJC66) and in at least 3 of the following 5 items: physician's global assessment of disease activity (PGA) and subject's global assessment of disease activity (SGA) assessed using visual analog scale (VAS) on a scale of 0-100 (0 and 100 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity)participant's pain assessment using VAS on a scale of 0-100 (0 and 100 indicating no pain and unbearable pain) health assessment questionnaire-disability index (HAQ-DI) score contains 20 questions,8 components: dressing/ grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip and activities and scored on a scale of 0-3 (0 and 3 indicating without difficulty and unable to do); high-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hsCRP). Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Health Assessment Questionnaire-Disability Index (HAQ-DI) Score at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The HAQ-DI score is defined as the average of the scores of eight functional categories (dressing and grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and other activities), usually completed by the participant. Responses in each functional category are collected as 0 (without any difficulty) to 3 (unable to do a task in that area), with or without aids or devices. The eight category scores are averaged into an overall HAQ-DI score on a scale from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled). When 6 or more categories are non-missing, total possible score is 3. If more than 2 categories are missing, the HAQ-DI score is set to missing. Negative change from baseline indicates improvement (less disability).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Disease Activity Score for 28 Joint Count Using C-Reactive Protein [DAS28 (CRP)] < 2.6 at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The DAS28 score is a measure of the participant's disease activity calculated using the tender joint counts (28 joints), swollen joint counts (28 joints), SGA (VAS: 0 = no disease activity to 100 = maximum disease activity), and hsCRP (CRP = hsCRP) for a total possible score of 1 to 9.4. Higher values indicate higher disease activity. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Modified Total Sharp Score (mTSS) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's radiographs of bilateral hands, wrists and feet are taken and evaluated through central review using the mTSS method. The mTSS (range [0-448]) is defined as the erosion score (range [0-280]) plus the joint space narrowing (JSN) score (range [0-168]). An erosion score of 0 to 5 is given to each joint in the hands and wrists, and a score of 0 to 10 is given to each joint in the feet where 0 indicates no erosion while 5 or 10 indicates extensive loss of bone (maximum erosion). JSN is scored from 0 to 4, with 0 indicating normal or no narrowing and 4 indicating complete loss of joint space. The maximal TSS is 448. Negative change in value indicates improvement (less erosion of bone, normal joint spaces).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved DAS28 (CRP) ≤ 3.2 at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The DAS28 score is a measure of the participant's disease activity calculated using the tender joint counts (28 joints), swollen joint counts (28 joints), SGA (VAS: 0 = no disease activity to 100 = maximum disease activity), and hsCRP for a total possible score of 1 to 9.4. Higher values indicate higher disease activity. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 36-Item Short Form Survey (SF-36) Physical Component Summary (PCS) Score at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 is a 36-item, self-reported, generic, comprehensive, and health-related quality of life questionnaire based on 8 health domains in 2 components: physical well-being (physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health perceptions), mental well-being (vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health). Each domain is scored by summing the individual items and transforming the scores into a 0 to 100 scale with highest possible score of 100. Higher scores indicate better health status or functioning. Positive change in value indicates improvement and better quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT)-Fatigue Score at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: FACIT-Fatigue scale is a brief, 13-item, symptom-specific questionnaire that specifically assesses the self-reported severity of fatigue and its impact upon daily activities and functioning in the past 7 days. The FACIT-Fatigue uses 0 (not at all) to 4 (very much) numeric rating scales for a total possible score of 0 to 52. Positive change in value indicates improvement (no or less severity of fatigue).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved ACR 50% Improvement (ACR50) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: ACR50 response is achieved when the participant has: ≥50% improvement (reduction) from baseline in TJC68, SJC66 and in at least 3 of the following 5 items: PGA and SGA assessed using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]; subject's pain assessment using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no pain and unbearable pain]; HAQ-DI score contains 20 questions, 8 components: dressing/grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip and activities and scored on a scale of 0-3 [0 and 3 indicating without difficulty and unable to do]; hsCRP. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved ACR50 at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: ACR50 response is achieved when the participant has: ≥50% improvement (reduction) from baseline in TJC68, SJC66 and in at least 3 of the following 5 items: PGA and SGA assessed using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]; subject's pain assessment using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no pain and unbearable pain]; HAQ-DI score contains 20 questions, 8 components: dressing/grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip and activities and scored on a scale of 0-3 [0 and 3 indicating without difficulty and unable to do]; hsCRP. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved ACR 70% Improvement (ACR70) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: ACR70 response is achieved when the participant has: ≥70% improvement (reduction) from baseline in TJC68, SJC66 and in at least 3 of the following 5 items: PGA and SGA assessed using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]; subject's pain assessment using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no pain and unbearable pain]; HAQ-DI score contains 20 questions, 8 components: dressing/grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip and activities and scored on a scale of 0-3 [0 and 3 indicating without difficulty and unable to do]; hsCRP. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved ACR70 at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: ACR70 response is achieved when the participant has: ≥70% improvement (reduction) from baseline in TJC68, SJC66 and in at least 3 of the following 5 items: PGA and SGA assessed using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]; subject's pain assessment using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no pain and unbearable pain]; HAQ-DI score contains 20 questions, 8 components: dressing/grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip and activities and scored on a scale of 0-3 [0 and 3 indicating without difficulty and unable to do]; hsCRP. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved ACR20 Response at Weeks 2, 4, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: ACR20 response is achieved when the participant has: ≥20% improvement (reduction) from baseline in TJC68, SJC66 and in at least 3 of the following 5 items: PGA and SGA assessed using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]; subject's pain assessment using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no pain and unbearable pain]; HAQ-DI score contains 20 questions, 8 components: dressing/grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip and activities and scored on a scale of 0-3 [0 and 3 indicating without difficulty and unable to do]; hsCRP. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved ACR20 Response at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: ACR20 response is achieved when the participant has: ≥20% improvement (reduction) from baseline in TJC68, SJC66 and in at least 3 of the following 5 items: PGA and SGA assessed using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]; subject's pain assessment using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no pain and unbearable pain]; HAQ-DI score contains 20 questions, 8 components: dressing/grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip and activities and scored on a scale of 0-3 [0 and 3 indicating without difficulty and unable to do]; hsCRP. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: HAQ-DI at Weeks 2, 4, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The HAQ-DI score is defined as the average of the scores of eight functional categories (dressing and grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and other activities), usually completed by the participant. Responses in each functional category are collected as 0 (without any difficulty) to 3 (unable to do a task in that area), with or without aids or devices. The eight category scores are averaged into an overall HAQ-DI score on a scale from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled). A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: HAQ-DI at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: The HAQ-DI score is defined as the average of the scores of eight functional categories (dressing and grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and other activities), usually completed by the participant. Responses in each functional category are collected as 0 (without any difficulty) to 3 (unable to do a task in that area), with or without aids or devices. The eight category scores are averaged into an overall HAQ-DI score on a scale from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled). A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: Tender Joint Count Based on 68 Joints (TJC68) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: TJC was examined on 68 joints of the fingers, elbows, hips, knees, ankles, and toes distal for pain in response to pressure or passive motion at the study time points. Joint pain was scored as 0 = Absent; 1 = Present for each joint. The overall Tender Joint Count ranged from 0 to 68. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: TJC68 at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: TJC was examined on 68 joints of the fingers, elbows, hips, knees, ankles, and toes distal for pain in response to pressure or passive motion at the study time points. Joint pain was scored as 0 = Absent; 1 = Present for each joint. The overall Tender Joint Count ranged from 0 to 68. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: Swollen Joint Count Based on 66 Joints (SJC66) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The total SJC66 was based on 66 joints (same 68 joints counted in TJC68 minus hips). It was derived as the sum of all "1s" (presence of a joint swelling was scored as "1" and the absence of swelling was scored as "0," provided the joint was not replaced or could not be assessed due to other reasons) thus collected with no penalty considered for the joints not assessed or those which had been replaced. The range for SJC66 is 0 to 66. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: SJC66 at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: The total SJC66 was based on 66 joints (same 68 joints counted in TJC68 minus hips). It was derived as the sum of all "1s" (presence of a joint swelling was scored as "1" and the absence of swelling was scored as "0," provided the joint was not replaced or could not be assessed due to other reasons) thus collected with no penalty considered for the joints not assessed or those which had been replaced. The range for SJC66 is 0 to 66. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: Subject's Global Assessment of Disease Activity (SGA) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: SGA was assessed by the participant using a VAS on a scale of 0 (no disease activity) to 100 (maximum disease activity). A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: SGA at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: SGA was assessed by the participant using a VAS on a scale of 0 (no disease activity) to 100 (maximum disease activity). A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity (PGA) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: PGA was assessed by the physician using a VAS on a scale of 0 (no disease activity) to 100 (maximum disease activity). A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: PGA at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: PGA was assessed by the physician using a VAS on a scale of 0 (no disease activity) to 100 (maximum disease activity). A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: Subject's Pain Assessment at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The participant assessed their pain severity using a VAS on a scale of 0 (no pain) to 100 (severe pain). A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: Subject's Pain Assessment at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: The participant assessed their pain severity using a VAS on a scale of 0 (no pain) to 100 (severe pain). A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: High-Sensitivity C-Reactive Protein (hsCRP) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: hsCRP at Weeks 36, and 52
Percentage of Participants Who Achieved an Improvement (Decrease) in the HAQ-DI Score ≥ 0.22 at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The HAQ-DI score is defined as the average of the scores of eight functional categories (dressing and grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and other activities), usually completed by the participant. Responses in each functional category are collected as 0 (without any difficulty) to 3 (unable to do a task in that area), with or without aids or devices. The eight category scores are averaged into an overall HAQ-DI score on a scale from 0-3 [0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled) when 6 or more categories are non-missing, so total possible score is 3. Improvement is defined as reduction in HAQ-DI, (baseline value - postbaseline value) ≥ 0.22. If more than 2 categories are missing, the HAQ-DI score is set to missing. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved an Improvement (Decrease) in the HAQ-DI Score ≥ 0.22 at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: The HAQ-DI score is defined as the average of the scores of eight functional categories (dressing and grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and other activities), usually completed by the participant. Responses in each functional category are collected as 0 (without any difficulty) to 3 (unable to do a task in that area), with or without aids or devices. The eight category scores are averaged into an overall HAQ-DI score on a scale from 0-3 [0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled) when 6 or more categories are non-missing, so total possible score is 3. Improvement is defined as reduction in HAQ-DI, (baseline value - postbaseline value) ≥ 0.22. If more than 2 categories are missing, the HAQ-DI score is set to missing. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in DAS28 (CRP) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The DAS28 score is a measure of the participant's disease activity calculated using the tender joint counts (28 joints), swollen joint counts (28 joints), SGA (VAS: 0 = no disease activity to 100 = maximum disease activity), and hsCRP for a total possible score of 1 to 9.4. Higher values indicate higher disease activity. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

Higher values indicate higher disease activity. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved DAS28 (CRP) ≤ 3.2 at Weeks 2, 4, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The DAS28 score is a measure of the participant's disease activity calculated using the tender joint counts (28 joints), swollen joint counts (28 joints), SGA (VAS: 0 = no disease activity to 100 = maximum disease activity), and hsCRP for a total possible score of 1 to 9.4. secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved DAS28 (CRP) ≤ 3.2 at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: The DAS28 score is a measure of the participant's disease activity calculated using the tender joint counts (28 joints), swollen joint counts (28 joints), SGA (VAS: 0 = no disease activity to 100 = maximum disease activity), and hsCRP for a total possible score of 1 to 9.4. Higher values indicate higher disease activity. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved DAS28 (CRP) < 2.6 at Weeks 2, 4, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The DAS28 score is a measure of the participant's disease activity calculated using the tender joint counts (28 joints), swollen joint counts (28 joints), SGA (VAS: 0 = no disease activity to 100 = maximum disease activity), and hsCRP for a total possible score of 1 to 9.4. Higher values indicate higher disease activity. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved DAS28 (CRP) < 2.6 at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: The DAS28 score is a measure of the participant's disease activity calculated using the tender joint counts (28 joints), swollen joint counts (28 joints), SGA (VAS: 0 = no disease activity to 100 = maximum disease activity), and hsCRP for a total possible score of 1 to 9.4. Higher values indicate higher disease activity. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: American College of Rheumatology N Percent Improvement (ACR-N) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: ACR-N is defined as the smallest percentage improvement from baseline in swollen joints, tender joints and the median of the following 5 items (PGA, SGA, subject's pain assessment, HAQ-DI and hsCRP). It has a range between 0 and 100%. PGA and SGA assessed using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]; subject's pain assessment using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no pain and unbearable pain]; HAQ-DI score contains 20 questions,8 components: dressing/grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip and activities and scored on a scale of 0-3 [0 and 3 indicating without difficulty and unable to do]. If this calculation results in a negative value, then the ACR-N is set to 0. The ACR-N value indicates an improvement of N%, with higher numbers indicating greater improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR N Percent Improvement (ACR-N) at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: ACR-N is defined as the smallest percentage improvement from baseline in swollen joints, tender joints and the median of the following 5 items (PGA, SGA, subject's pain assessment, HAQ-DI and hsCRP). It has a range between 0 and 100%. PGA and SGA assessed using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]; subject's pain assessment using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no pain and unbearable pain]; HAQ-DI score contains 20 questions,8 components: dressing/grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip and activities and scored on a scale of 0-3 [0 and 3 indicating without difficulty and unable to do]. If this calculation results in a negative value, then the ACR-N is set to 0. The ACR-N value indicates an improvement of N%, with higher numbers indicating greater improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR) Response at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: Good Response: DAS28(CRP) at visit ≤3.2 and improvement from baseline >1.2. Moderate Response: DAS28(CRP) at visit ≤3.2 and improvement from baseline >0.6 and ≤1.2; DAS28(CRP) at visit >3.2 and ≤5.1 and improvement from baseline >0.6; DAS 28(CRP) at visit >5.1 and improvement from baseline >1.2. No Response: DAS28(CRP) at visit ≤5.1 and improvement from baseline ≤0.6; DAS 28(CRP) >5.1 at visit and improvement from baseline ≤1.2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With EULAR Response at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: Good Response: DAS28(CRP) at visit ≤3.2 and improvement from baseline >1.2. Moderate Response: DAS28(CRP) at visit ≤3.2 and improvement from baseline >0.6 and ≤1.2; DAS28(CRP) at visit >3.2 and ≤5.1 and improvement from baseline >0.6; DAS 28(CRP) at visit >5.1 and improvement from baseline >1.2. No Response: DAS28(CRP) at visit ≤5.1 and improvement from baseline ≤0.6; DAS 28(CRP) >5.1 at visit and improvement from baseline ≤1.2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Clinical Disease Activity Index (CDAI) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: CDAI is calculated using formula: CDAI = TJC based on 28 joints (TJC28) + SJC based on 28 joints (SJC28) + SGA + PGA. PGA and SGA are assessed using a VAS on a scale of 0-10 [0 and 10 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]. CDAI can range from 0 to 76, with higher score indicating more severe disease activity status. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in CDAI at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: CDAI is calculated using formula: CDAI = TJC28 + SJC28 + SGA + PGA. PGA and SGA are assessed using a VAS on a scale of 0-10 [0 and 10 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]. CDAI can range from 0 to 76, with higher score indicating more severe disease activity status. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Simplified Disease Activity Index (SDAI) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: SDAI is a composite measure that sums the TJC28, SJC28, SGA, PGA, and the hsCRP (in mg/dL). PGA and SGA assessed using VAS on a scale of 0-10 [0 and 10 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]. Higher score indicates more severe disease activity status and total possible score is 0 to 86. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in SDAI at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: SDAI is a composite measure that sums the TJC28, SJC28, SGA, PGA, and the hsCRP (in mg/dL). PGA and SGA assessed using VAS on a scale of 0-10 [0 and 10 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]. Higher score indicates more severe disease activity status and total possible score is 0 to 86. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in mTSS at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's radiographs of bilateral hands, wrists and feet are taken and evaluated through central review using the mTSS method. The mTSS (range [0-448]) is defined as the erosion score (range [0-280]) plus the joint space narrowing (JSN) score (range [0-168]). An erosion score of 0 to 5 is given to each joint in the hands and wrists, and a score of 0 to 10 is given to each joint in the feet where 0 indicates no erosion while 5 or 10 indicates extensive loss of bone (maximum erosion). JSN is scored from 0 to 4, with 0 indicating normal or no narrowing and 4 indicating complete loss of joint space. The maximal TSS is 448. Negative change in value indicates improvement (less erosion of bone, normal joint spaces).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With no Radiographic Progression From Baseline at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's radiographs of bilateral hands, wrists and feet are taken and evaluated through central review using the mTSS method. No radiographic progression is defined by the change from baseline in mTSS and is reported for the following categories: Change in mTSS ≤ 0.5, Change in mTSS ≤ 0 and Change in mTSS ≤ smallest detectable change (SDC).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With no Radiographic Progression From Baseline at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's radiographs of bilateral hands, wrists and feet are taken and evaluated through central review using the mTSS method. No radiographic progression is defined by the change from baseline in mTSS and is reported for the following categories: Change in mTSS ≤ 0.5, Change in mTSS ≤ 0 and Change in mTSS ≤ smallest detectable change (SDC).

secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 is a 36-item, self-reported, generic, comprehensive, and health-related quality of life questionnaire based on 8 health domains in 2 components: physical well-being (physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health perceptions), mental well-being (vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health). Each domain is scored by summing the individual items and transforming the scores into a 0 to 100 scale with highest possible score of 100. Higher scores indicate better health status or functioning.

Higher scores indicate better health status or functioning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in SF-36 MCS Score at Weeks 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 is a 36-item, self-reported, generic, comprehensive, and health-related quality of life questionnaire based on 8 health domains in 2 components: physical well-being (physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health perceptions), mental well-being (vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health). Each domain is scored by summing the individual items and transforming the scores into a 0 to 100 scale with highest possible score of 100. Higher scores indicate better health status or functioning. Positive change in value indicates improvement and better quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in SF-36 MCS Score at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 is a 36-item, self-reported, generic, comprehensive, and health-related quality of life questionnaire based on 8 health domains in 2 components: physical well-being (physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health perceptions), mental well-being (vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health). Each domain is scored by summing the individual items and transforming the scores into a 0 to 100 scale with highest possible score of 100. Higher scores indicate better health status or functioning. Positive change in value indicates improvement and better quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT)-Fatigue Score at Weeks 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: FACIT-Fatigue scale is a brief, 13-item, symptom-specific questionnaire that specifically assesses the self-reported severity of fatigue and its impact upon daily activities and functioning in the past 7 days. The FACIT-Fatigue uses 0 (not at all) to 4 (very much) numeric rating scales for a total possible score of 0 to 52.

secondary_outcome.measure: FACIT-Fatigue Score at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: FACIT-Fatigue scale is a brief, 13-item, symptom-specific questionnaire that specifically assesses the self-reported severity of fatigue and its impact upon daily activities and functioning in the past 7 days. The FACIT-Fatigue uses 0 (not at all) to 4 (very much) numeric rating scales for a total possible score of 0 to 52.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in FACIT-Fatigue Score at Weeks 4, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: FACIT-Fatigue scale is a brief, 13-item, symptom-specific questionnaire that specifically assesses the self-reported severity of fatigue and its impact upon daily activities and functioning in the past 7 days. The FACIT-Fatigue uses 0 (not at all) to 4 (very much) numeric rating scales for a total possible score of 0 to 52. Positive change in value indicates improvement (no or less severity of fatigue).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in FACIT-Fatigue Score at Weeks 36, and 52
secondary_outcome.description: FACIT-Fatigue scale is a brief, 13-item, symptom-specific questionnaire that specifically assesses the self-reported severity of fatigue and its impact upon daily activities and functioning in the past 7 days. The FACIT-Fatigue uses 0 (not at all) to 4 (very much) numeric rating scales for a total possible score of 0 to 52. Positive change in value indicates improvement (no or less severity of fatigue).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants by European Quality of Life 5 Dimensions (EQ-5D) Health Profile Categories at Weeks 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D-5 levels (EQ-5D-5L) is a standardized measure of health status of the participant at the visit (same day) that provides a simple, generic measure of health for clinical and economic appraisal. EQ-5D-5L consists of 2 components: a descriptive system of the participant's health and a rating of his or her current health state on a 0-100 VAS. The descriptive system comprises the following 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 5 levels: no problems, slight problems, moderate problems, severe problems, and extreme problems. Rating gets recorded on a vertical VAS in which the endpoints are labeled best imaginable health state is 100 (on the top) and worst imaginable health state is 0 (on the bottom). Higher scores of EQ VAS indicate better health.

secondary_outcome.measure: Work Productivity and Activity Impairment-Rheumatoid Arthritis (WPAI-RA): Mean Percentage of Work Time Missed (Absenteeism) at Weeks 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The WPAI is a questionnaire that measures impairments in work activities in participants with RA which consists of 6 questions: Q1-currently employed; Q2-work time missed due to RA; Q3-work time missed due to other reasons; Q4-hours actually worked; Q5-degree RA affected productivity while working (0-10 VAS, with 0 indicating no effect and 10 indicating RA completely prevented the participant from working); Q6-degree RA affected productivity in regular unpaid activities (0-10 VAS, with 0 indicating no effect and 10 indicating RA completely prevented the participant's daily activities). Outcomes are expressed as impairment percentages: Absenteeism (work time missed) due to RA: 100×{Q2/(Q2+Q4)}. Higher numbers indicate greater impairment and less productivity.

Outcomes are expressed as impairment percentages: Presenteeism (impairment while working) due to RA: 100×{Q5/10}. Higher numbers indicate greater impairment and less productivity.

secondary_outcome.measure: WPAI-RA: Mean Percentage of Overall Work Productivity Impairment Due to RA at Weeks 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The WPAI is a questionnaire that measures impairments in work activities in participants with RA which consists of 6 questions: Q1-currently employed; Q2-work time missed due to RA; Q3-work time missed due to other reasons; Q4-hours actually worked; Q5-degree RA affected productivity while working (0-10 VAS, with 0 indicating no effect and 10 indicating RA completely prevented the participant from working); Q6-degree RA affected productivity in regular unpaid activities (0-10 VAS, with 0 indicating no effect and 10 indicating RA completely prevented the participant's daily activities). Outcomes are expressed as impairment percentages: Work productivity loss (overall work impairment) due to RA: 100×{Q2/(Q2+Q4) + [(1-Q2/(Q2+Q4) × (Q5/10)]}. Higher numbers indicate greater impairment and less productivity.

Outcomes are expressed as impairment percentages: Activity impairment due to RA: 100×{Q6/10}. If Question 1 (Are you currently employed?) is 'NO', then only the activity impairment score can be determined. Higher numbers indicate greater impairment and less productivity.

arm_group.description: Filgotinib 200 mg + placebo to match filgotinib 100 mg + placebo to match adalimumab 40 mg in addition to a stable dose of methotrexate (MTX)
Filgotinib 100 mg + placebo to match filgotinib 200 mg + placebo to match adalimumab 40 mg in addition to a stable dose of MTX
Placebo to match filgotinib 200 mg + placebo to match filgotinib 100 mg + adalimumab 40 mg in addition to a stable dose of MTX

Placebo to match filgotinib 200 mg + placebo to match filgotinib 100 mg + placebo to match adalimumab 40 mg in addition to a stable dose of MTX for up to 24 weeks. After 24 weeks, participants will be rerandomized to filgotinib 200 mg to receive filgotinib 200 mg + placebo to match filgotinib 100 mg + placebo to match adalimumab 40 mg in addition to a stable dose of MTX.

Placebo to match filgotinib 200 mg + placebo to match filgotinib 100 mg + placebo to match adalimumab 40 mg in addition to a stable dose of MTX for up to 24 weeks. After 24 weeks, participants will be rerandomized to filgotinib 100 mg to receive filgotinib 100 mg + placebo to match filgotinib 200 mg + placebo to match adalimumab 40 mg in addition to a stable dose of MTX.
Placebo to match filgotinib 200 mg + placebo to match filgotinib 100 mg + placebo to match adalimumab 40 mg in addition to a stable dose of MTX for up to 24 weeks.

intervention.description: 200 mg or 100 mg tablet(s) administered orally once daily
40 mg administered via subcutaneous injection once every two weeks
Administered via subcutaneous injection once every two weeks

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Have a diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis (RA) [2010 American College of Rheumatology (ACR)/European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR) criteria] , and are ACR functional class I-III.
- Have ≥ 6 swollen joints (from a swollen joint count based on 66 joints (SJC66)) and ≥ 6 tender joints (from a tender joint count based on 68 joints (TJC68)) at both screening and Day 1.
- Ongoing treatment with a stable dose of MTX
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous treatment with any janus kinase (JAK) inhibitor
NOTE: Other protocol defined Inclusion/ Exclusion criteria may apply.

results_reference.citation: Combe B, Kivitz A, Tanaka Y, van der Heijde D, Matzkies F, Bartok B, et al. Efficacy and safety of filgotinib for patients with rheumatoid arthritis with inadequate response to methotrexate: FINCH 1 primary outcome results. Ann Rheum Dis 2019; 78 (supplement 2):A77.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled at study sites in Asia, South Africa, Australia, Europe, North America, South America, and New Zealand. The first participant was screened on 30 August 2016. The last study visit occurred on 20 June 2019.

group.title: Filgotinib 200 mg
group.description: Participants were administered a filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + placebo to match (PTM) filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg subcutaneous (SC) injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Filgotinib 100 mg
group.description: Participants were administered a filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: Participants were administered PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Placebo to Filgotinib 200 mg
group.description: Participants in the placebo arm were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily+ a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 24 weeks. Then the participants in the placebo arm were rerandomized to filgotinib 200 mg and were administered a filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 28.1 weeks.

group.title: Placebo to Filgotinib 100 mg
group.description: Participants in the placebo arm were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily+ a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 24 weeks. Then the participants in the placebo arm were rerandomized to filgotinib 100 mg and were administered a filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 28.1 weeks.

group.title: Placebo Never Received Filgotinib
group.description: Participants in the placebo arm were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily+ a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 24 weeks.

participants_list.participants: Completed 24 weeks of placebo treatment and not rerandomized to Filgotinib 200 mg or 100 mg groups

baseline.population: The Safety Analysis Set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.title: Filgotinib 200 mg
group.description: Participants were administered a filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + placebo to match (PTM) filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg subcutaneous (SC) injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Filgotinib 100 mg
group.description: Participants were administered a filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: Participants were administered PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: The Placebo arm includes all participants who received placebo in the study. Participants were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily+ a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 24 weeks. Participants could be rerandomized to filgotinib 200 mg or 100 mg groups.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved an American College of Rheumatology (ACR) 20% Improvement (ACR20) Response at Week 12
outcome.description: ACR20 response is achieved when the participant has: ≥20% improvement (reduction) from baseline in tender joint count based on 68 joints (TJC68), swollen joint count based on 66 joints (SJC66) and in at least 3 of the following 5 items: physician's global assessment of disease activity (PGA) and subject's global assessment of disease activity (SGA) assessed using visual analog scale (VAS) on a scale of 0-100 (0 and 100 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity)participant's pain assessment using VAS on a scale of 0-100 (0 and 100 indicating no pain and unbearable pain) health assessment questionnaire-disability index (HAQ-DI) score contains 20 questions,8 components: dressing/ grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip and activities and scored on a scale of 0-3 (0 and 3 indicating without difficulty and unable to do); high-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hsCRP). Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set included participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.title: Filgotinib 200 mg

group.description: The Placebo arm included all participants who received placebo in the study. Participants were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily+ a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of 24 weeks. Participants could be rerandomized to filgotinib 200 mg or 100 mg groups.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved an American College of Rheumatology (ACR) 20% Improvement (ACR20) Response at Week 12
measure.description: ACR20 response is achieved when the participant has: ≥20% improvement (reduction) from baseline in tender joint count based on 68 joints (TJC68), swollen joint count based on 66 joints (SJC66) and in at least 3 of the following 5 items: physician's global assessment of disease activity (PGA) and subject's global assessment of disease activity (SGA) assessed using visual analog scale (VAS) on a scale of 0-100 (0 and 100 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity)participant's pain assessment using VAS on a scale of 0-100 (0 and 100 indicating no pain and unbearable pain) health assessment questionnaire-disability index (HAQ-DI) score contains 20 questions,8 components: dressing/ grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip and activities and scored on a scale of 0-3 (0 and 3 indicating without difficulty and unable to do); high-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hsCRP). Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.
measure.population: The Full Analysis Set included participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study drug.

analysis.groups_desc: Filgotinib 200 mg vs Placebo at Week 12
analysis.p_value_desc: P-value was calculated from the logistic regression with treatment groups and stratification factors in the model.

analysis.groups_desc: Filgotinib 100 mg vs Placebo at Week 12
analysis.p_value_desc: P-value was calculated from the logistic regression with treatment groups and stratification factors in the model.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Health Assessment Questionnaire-Disability Index (HAQ-DI) Score at Week 12
outcome.description: The HAQ-DI score is defined as the average of the scores of eight functional categories (dressing and grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and other activities), usually completed by the participant. Responses in each functional category are collected as 0 (without any difficulty) to 3 (unable to do a task in that area), with or without aids or devices. The eight category scores are averaged into an overall HAQ-DI score on a scale from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled). When 6 or more categories are non-missing, total possible score is 3. If more than 2 categories are missing, the HAQ-DI score is set to missing. Negative change from baseline indicates improvement (less disability).
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

group.title: Filgotinib 200 mg
group.description: Participants were administered a filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + a placebo to match (PTM) filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg subcutaneous (SC) injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Disease Activity Score for 28 Joint Count Using C-Reactive Protein [DAS28 (CRP)] < 2.6 at Week 12
outcome.description: The DAS28 score is a measure of the participant's disease activity calculated using the tender joint counts (28 joints), swollen joint counts (28 joints), SGA (VAS: 0 = no disease activity to 100 = maximum disease activity), and hsCRP (CRP = hsCRP) for a total possible score of 1 to 9.4. Higher values indicate higher disease activity. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set were analyzed.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Modified Total Sharp Score (mTSS) at Week 24
outcome.description: Participant's radiographs of bilateral hands, wrists and feet are taken and evaluated through central review using the mTSS method. The mTSS (range [0-448]) is defined as the erosion score (range [0-280]) plus the joint space narrowing (JSN) score (range [0-168]). An erosion score of 0 to 5 is given to each joint in the hands and wrists, and a score of 0 to 10 is given to each joint in the feet where 0 indicates no erosion while 5 or 10 indicates extensive loss of bone (maximum erosion). JSN is scored from 0 to 4, with 0 indicating normal or no narrowing and 4 indicating complete loss of joint space. The maximal TSS is 448. Negative change in value indicates improvement (less erosion of bone, normal joint spaces).
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

group.description: Participants were administered a filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + a placebo to match (PTM) filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg subcutaneous (SC) injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in 36-Item Short Form Survey (SF-36) Physical Component Summary (PCS) Score at Week 12
outcome.description: The SF-36 is a 36-item, self-reported, generic, comprehensive, and health-related quality of life questionnaire based on 8 health domains in 2 components: physical well-being (physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health perceptions), mental well-being (vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health). Each domain is scored by summing the individual items and transforming the scores into a 0 to 100 scale with highest possible score of 100. Higher scores indicate better health status or functioning. Positive change in value indicates improvement and better quality of life.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

group.description: Participants were administered a filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + a placebo to match (PTM) filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg subcutaneous (SC) injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT)-Fatigue Score at Week 12
outcome.description: FACIT-Fatigue scale is a brief, 13-item, symptom-specific questionnaire that specifically assesses the self-reported severity of fatigue and its impact upon daily activities and functioning in the past 7 days. The FACIT-Fatigue uses 0 (not at all) to 4 (very much) numeric rating scales for a total possible score of 0 to 52. Positive change in value indicates improvement (no or less severity of fatigue).
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: Participants were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Placebo to Filgotinib 200 mg
group.description: Participants in the placebo arm were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily+ a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 24 weeks. Then the participants in the placebo arm were rerandomized to filgotinib 200 mg and were administered a filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 28.1 weeks.

group.title: Placebo to Filgotinib 100 mg
group.description: Participants in the placebo arm were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily+ a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 24 weeks. Then the participants in the placebo arm were rerandomized to filgotinib 100 mg and were administered a filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 28.1 weeks.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved ACR50 at Weeks 36, and 52
measure.description: ACR50 response is achieved when the participant has: ≥50% improvement (reduction) from baseline in TJC68, SJC66 and in at least 3 of the following 5 items: PGA and SGA assessed using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]; subject's pain assessment using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no pain and unbearable pain]; HAQ-DI score contains 20 questions, 8 components: dressing/grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip and activities and scored on a scale of 0-3 [0 and 3 indicating without difficulty and unable to do]; hsCRP. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set were analyzed.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved ACR 70% Improvement (ACR70) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24

measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set were analyzed.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: HAQ-DI at Weeks 2, 4, and 24
outcome.description: The HAQ-DI score is defined as the average of the scores of eight functional categories (dressing and grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and other activities), usually completed by the participant. Responses in each functional category are collected as 0 (without any difficulty) to 3 (unable to do a task in that area), with or without aids or devices. The eight category scores are averaged into an overall HAQ-DI score on a scale from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled). A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

analysis.groups_desc: Filgotinib 200 mg vs Placebo at Week 2. LS-Mean, 95% CI, and P-value were provided from MMRM. Missing change scores were not imputed using the MMRM approach assuming an unstructured variance-covariance matrix for the repeated measures.
analysis.p_value_desc: MMRM model included treatment, visit, treatment by visit, stratification factors, and baseline value as fixed effects, and participants being the random effect.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: Tender Joint Count Based on 68 Joints (TJC68) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
outcome.description: TJC was examined on 68 joints of the fingers, elbows, hips, knees, ankles, and toes distal for pain in response to pressure or passive motion at the study time points. Joint pain was scored as 0 = Absent; 1 = Present for each joint. The overall Tender Joint Count ranged from 0 to 68. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: TJC68 at Weeks 36, and 52
outcome.description: TJC was examined on 68 joints of the fingers, elbows, hips, knees, ankles, and toes distal for pain in response to pressure or passive motion at the study time points. Joint pain was scored as 0 = Absent; 1 = Present for each joint. The overall Tender Joint Count ranged from 0 to 68. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

group.title: Filgotinib 200 mg
group.description: Participants were administered a filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + a placebo to match (PTM) filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg subcutaneous (SC) injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Filgotinib 100 mg
group.description: Participants were administered a filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: Participants were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Placebo to Filgotinib 200 mg
group.description: Participants in the placebo arm were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily+ a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 24 weeks. Then the participants in the placebo arm were rerandomized to filgotinib 200 mg and were administered a filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 28.1 weeks.

group.title: Placebo to Filgotinib 100 mg
group.description: Participants in the placebo arm were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily+ a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 24 weeks. Then the participants in the placebo arm were rerandomized to filgotinib 100 mg and were administered a filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 28.1 weeks.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: TJC68 at Weeks 36, and 52
measure.description: TJC was examined on 68 joints of the fingers, elbows, hips, knees, ankles, and toes distal for pain in response to pressure or passive motion at the study time points. Joint pain was scored as 0 = Absent; 1 = Present for each joint. The overall Tender Joint Count ranged from 0 to 68. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: Swollen Joint Count Based on 66 Joints (SJC66) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
outcome.description: The total SJC66 was based on 66 joints (same 68 joints counted in TJC68 minus hips). It was derived as the sum of all "1s" (presence of a joint swelling was scored as "1" and the absence of swelling was scored as "0," provided the joint was not replaced or could not be assessed due to other reasons) thus collected with no penalty considered for the joints not assessed or those which had been replaced. The range for SJC66 is 0 to 66. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

group.title: Filgotinib 200 mg
group.description: Participants were administered a filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + a placebo to match (PTM) filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg subcutaneous (SC) injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: The Placebo arm included all participants who received placebo in the study. Participants were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily+ a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 24 weeks. Participants could be rerandomized to filgotinib 200 mg or filgotinib 100 mg.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: Swollen Joint Count Based on 66 Joints (SJC66) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
measure.description: The total SJC66 was based on 66 joints (same 68 joints counted in TJC68 minus hips). measure.title: Change From Baseline in Individual ACR Component: hsCRP at Weeks 36, and 52
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved an Improvement (Decrease) in the HAQ-DI Score ≥ 0.22 at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
outcome.description: The HAQ-DI score is defined as the average of the scores of eight functional categories (dressing and grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and other activities), usually completed by the participant. Responses in each functional category are collected as 0 (without any difficulty) to 3 (unable to do a task in that area), with or without aids or devices. The eight category scores are averaged into an overall HAQ-DI score on a scale from 0-3 [0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled) when 6 or more categories are non-missing, so total possible score is 3. Improvement is defined as reduction in HAQ-DI, (baseline value - postbaseline value) ≥ 0.22. If more than 2 categories are missing, the HAQ-DI score is set to missing. Participants with missing outcomes were set as non-responders.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in DAS28 (CRP) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
outcome.description: The DAS28 score is a measure of the participant's disease activity calculated using the tender joint counts (28 joints), swollen joint counts (28 joints), SGA (VAS: 0 = no disease activity to 100 = maximum disease activity), and hsCRP for a total possible score of 1 to 9.4. Higher values indicate higher disease activity. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in DAS28 (CRP) at Weeks 36, and 52
outcome.description: The DAS28 score is a measure of the participant's disease activity calculated using the tender joint counts (28 joints), swollen joint counts (28 joints), SGA (VAS: 0 = no disease activity to 100 = maximum disease activity), and hsCRP for a total possible score of 1 to 9.4. Higher values indicate higher disease activity. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

group.title: Filgotinib 200 mg
group.description: Participants were administered a filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + a placebo to match (PTM) filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg subcutaneous (SC) injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Filgotinib 100 mg
group.description: Participants were administered a filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: Participants were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Placebo to Filgotinib 200 mg
group.description: Participants in the placebo arm were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily+ a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 24 weeks. Then the participants in the placebo arm were rerandomized to filgotinib 200 mg and were administered a filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 28.1 weeks.

Then the participants in the placebo arm were rerandomized to filgotinib 100 mg and were administered a filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 28.1 weeks.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: For non-inferiority test, the approach proposed by Liu 2014 was used to demonstrate that each filgotinib dose preserves more than 50% of the effect of adalimumab on the response rate of DAS28 (CRP) < 2.6 at using NRI.
analysis.p_value_desc: P-value of non-inferiority test was calculated from approach proposed by [Liu 2014].

outcome.title: American College of Rheumatology N Percent Improvement (ACR-N) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
outcome.description: ACR-N is defined as the smallest percentage improvement from baseline in swollen joints, tender joints and the median of the following 5 items (PGA, SGA, subject's pain assessment, HAQ-DI and hsCRP). It has a range between 0 and 100%. PGA and SGA assessed using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]; subject's pain assessment using VAS on a scale of 0-100 [0 and 100 indicating no pain and unbearable pain]; HAQ-DI score contains 20 questions,8 components: dressing/grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip and activities and scored on a scale of 0-3 [0 and 3 indicating without difficulty and unable to do]. If this calculation results in a negative value, then the ACR-N is set to 0. The ACR-N value indicates an improvement of N%, with higher numbers indicating greater improvement.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR) Response at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
outcome.description: Good Response: DAS28(CRP) at visit ≤3.2 and improvement from baseline >1.2. Moderate Response: DAS28(CRP) at visit ≤3.2 and improvement from baseline >0.6 and ≤1.2; DAS28(CRP) at visit >3.2 and ≤5.1 and improvement from baseline >0.6; DAS 28(CRP) at visit >5.1 and improvement from baseline >1.2. No Response: DAS28(CRP) at visit ≤5.1 and improvement from baseline ≤0.6; DAS 28(CRP) >5.1 at visit and improvement from baseline ≤1.2.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

measure.title: Number of Participants With European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR) Response at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
measure.description: Good Response: DAS28(CRP) at visit ≤3.2 and improvement from baseline >1.2. Moderate Response: DAS28(CRP) at visit ≤3.2 and improvement from baseline >0.6 and ≤1.2; DAS28(CRP) at visit >3.2 and ≤5.1 and improvement from baseline >0.6; DAS 28(CRP) at visit >5.1 and improvement from baseline >1.2. No Response: DAS28(CRP) at visit ≤5.1 and improvement from baseline ≤0.6; DAS 28(CRP) >5.1 at visit and improvement from baseline ≤1.2.
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

measure.description: Good Response: DAS28(CRP) at visit ≤3.2 and improvement from baseline >1.2. outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Clinical Disease Activity Index (CDAI) at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 24
outcome.description: CDAI is calculated using formula: CDAI = TJC based on 28 joints (TJC28) + SJC based on 28 joints (SJC28) + SGA + PGA. PGA and SGA are assessed using a VAS on a scale of 0-10 [0 and 10 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]. CDAI can range from 0 to 76, with higher score indicating more severe disease activity status. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

outcome.description: SDAI is a composite measure that sums the TJC28, SJC28, SGA, PGA, and the hsCRP (in mg/dL). Higher score indicates more severe disease activity status and total possible score is 0 to 86. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in SDAI at Weeks 36, and 52
measure.description: SDAI is a composite measure that sums the TJC28, SJC28, SGA, PGA, and the hsCRP (in mg/dL). PGA and SGA assessed using VAS on a scale of 0-10 [0 and 10 indicating no disease activity and maximum disease activity]. Higher score indicates more severe disease activity status and total possible score is 0 to 86. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in mTSS at Week 52
outcome.description: Participant's radiographs of bilateral hands, wrists and feet are taken and evaluated through central review using the mTSS method. The mTSS (range [0-448]) is defined as the erosion score (range [0-280]) plus the joint space narrowing (JSN) score (range [0-168]). An erosion score of 0 to 5 is given to each joint in the hands and wrists, and a score of 0 to 10 is given to each joint in the feet where 0 indicates no erosion while 5 or 10 indicates extensive loss of bone (maximum erosion). JSN is scored from 0 to 4, with 0 indicating normal or no narrowing and 4 indicating complete loss of joint space. The maximal TSS is 448. Negative change in value indicates improvement (less erosion of bone, normal joint spaces).
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

group.description: Participants were administered a filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + a placebo to match (PTM) filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg subcutaneous (SC) injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With no Radiographic Progression From Baseline at Week 52
outcome.description: Participant's radiographs of bilateral hands, wrists and feet are taken and evaluated through central review using the mTSS method. No radiographic progression is defined by the change from baseline in mTSS and is reported for the following categories: Change in mTSS ≤ 0.5, Change in mTSS ≤ 0 and Change in mTSS ≤ smallest detectable change (SDC).
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

group.title: Filgotinib 200 mg
group.description: Participants were administered a filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + a placebo to match (PTM) filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg subcutaneous (SC) injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Filgotinib 100 mg
group.description: Participants were administered a filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: Participants were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 52.1 weeks.

group.title: Placebo to Filgotinib 200 mg
group.description: Participants in the placebo arm were administered a PTM filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily+ a PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 24 weeks. Then the participants in the placebo arm were rerandomized to filgotinib 200 mg and were administered a filgotinib 200 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM filgotinib 100 mg tablet orally, once daily + PTM adalimumab 40 mg SC injection, once every 2 weeks in addition to a weekly stable dose of MTX, orally for median exposure of up to 28.1 weeks.

No radiographic progression is defined by the change from baseline in mTSS and is reported for the following categories: Change in mTSS ≤ 0.5, Change in mTSS ≤ 0 and Change in mTSS ≤ smallest detectable change (SDC).
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

outcome.title: 36-Item Short Form Survey (SF-36) Physical Component Summary (PCS) Score at Weeks 4, 12, and 24
outcome.description: The SF-36 is a 36-item, self-reported, generic, comprehensive, and health-related quality of life questionnaire based on 8 health domains in 2 components: physical well-being (physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health perceptions), mental well-being (vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health). Each domain is scored by summing the individual items and transforming the scores into a 0 to 100 scale with highest possible score of 100. Higher scores indicate better health status or functioning.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

analysis.groups_desc: Filgotinib 200 mg vs Placebo at Week 4. LS-Mean, 95% CI, and P-value were provided from MMRM. Missing change scores were not imputed using the MMRM approach assuming an unstructured variance-covariance matrix for the repeated measures.
analysis.p_value_desc: MMRM model included treatment, visit, treatment by visit, stratification factors, and baseline value as fixed effects, and participants being the random effect.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in SF-36 MCS Score at Weeks 36, and 52
measure.description: The SF-36 is a 36-item, self-reported, generic, comprehensive, and health-related quality of life questionnaire based on 8 health domains in 2 components: physical well-being (physical functioning, role-physical, bodily pain, general health perceptions), mental well-being (vitality, social functioning, role-emotional, and mental health). Each domain is scored by summing the individual items and transforming the scores into a 0 to 100 scale with highest possible score of 100. Higher scores indicate better health status or functioning. Positive change in value indicates improvement and better quality of life.
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

outcome.title: Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT)-Fatigue Score at Weeks 4, 12, and 24
outcome.description: FACIT-Fatigue scale is a brief, 13-item, symptom-specific questionnaire that specifically assesses the self-reported severity of fatigue and its impact upon daily activities and functioning in the past 7 days. The FACIT-Fatigue uses 0 (not at all) to 4 (very much) numeric rating scales for a total possible score of 0 to 52.

analysis.groups_desc: Filgotinib 200 mg vs Placebo at Week 4. LS-Mean, 95% CI, and P-value were provided from MMRM. Missing change scores were not imputed using the MMRM approach assuming an unstructured variance-covariance matrix for the repeated measures.
analysis.p_value_desc: MMRM model included treatment, visit, treatment by visit, stratification factors, and baseline value as fixed effects, and participants being the random effect.

outcome.title: Number of Participants by European Quality of Life 5 Dimensions (EQ-5D) Health Profile Categories at Weeks 4, 12, and 24
outcome.description: The EQ-5D-5 levels (EQ-5D-5L) is a standardized measure of health status of the participant at the visit (same day) that provides a simple, generic measure of health for clinical and economic appraisal. EQ-5D-5L consists of 2 components: a descriptive system of the participant's health and a rating of his or her current health state on a 0-100 VAS. The descriptive system comprises the following 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 5 levels: no problems, slight problems, moderate problems, severe problems, and extreme problems. Rating gets recorded on a vertical VAS in which the endpoints are labeled best imaginable health state is 100 (on the top) and worst imaginable health state is 0 (on the bottom). Higher scores of EQ VAS indicate better health.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

group.title: Placebo

Participants could be rerandomized to filgotinib 200 mg or filgotinib 100 mg.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in EQ-5D Current Health VAS at Weeks 4, 12, and 24
measure.description: The EQ-5D-5L is a standardized measure of health status of the participant at the visit (same day) that provides a simple, generic measure of health for clinical and economic appraisal. Participant rates their current health state on a 0-100 VAS. It gets recorded on a vertical VAS in which the endpoints are labeled best imaginable health state is 100 (on the top) and worst imaginable health state is 0 (on the bottom). Higher scores of EQ VAS indicate better health. Positive change indicates improvement (better health).
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

analysis.groups_desc: Filgotinib 200 mg vs Placebo at Week 4. LS-Mean, 95% CI, and P-value were provided from MMRM. Missing change scores were not imputed using the MMRM approach assuming an unstructured variance-covariance matrix for the repeated measures.
analysis.p_value_desc: MMRM model included treatment, visit, treatment by visit, stratification factors, and baseline value as fixed effects, and participants being the random effect.

analysis.groups_desc: Filgotinib 100 mg vs Placebo at Week 4. LS-Mean, 95% CI, and P-value were provided from MMRM. Missing change scores were not imputed using the MMRM approach assuming an unstructured variance-covariance matrix for the repeated measures.

analysis.p_value_desc: MMRM model included treatment, visit, treatment by visit, stratification factors, and baseline value as fixed effects, and participants being the random effect.

analysis.p_value_desc: MMRM model included treatment, visit, treatment by visit, stratification factors, and baseline value as fixed effects, and participants being the random effect.
